reviews.sentence: Hotel in Need of a Refresh. The hotel was fine but definitely not up to the Westin standard. This hotel has seen better days. My room was fine but the bathroom desperately needs a revival. There were spots on the tub where you could see there was repair work done not well. The metal around the mirror was peeling turning color the lights take a few seconds to turn on and the toilet flush is very loud. The room was fine nice tv though not all the channels were HD. There is a self parking garage attached to the hotel which is convenient.
Heavenly bed friendly stafThe whole 11th floor smells like mold. The pool was closed due to renovations.

Excellent Stay. Really enjoyed our time at The Westin Long Beach. Was a pleasant surprise to find a cooler chiller in our room to keep our water cool. Nice walk to Aqaurium of the Pacific. The bed was so comfortable and the shower was amazing would have bought one of those if they had offered it. The pool was too hot for me to enjoy would have been more refreshing a few degrees cooler but hubby enjoyed it immensely. Have to give a HUGE shout out to J Kennedy. The Lobby Bar she really is top shelf when it comes to knowing her customers and how to quench their thirst. Hard working I witnessed her picking up snacks pl had dropped on the floor with a napkinothers were cleaning the whole time we were there as well really clean clean placeBUT I have never seen a bartender come around and clean the floor on the other side of the bar. Really impressed us. She deserves credit for doing such an amazing job and smiling the whole time while pl are yelling at their football teams and she never forgot a drink food order snack or to place a gentlemans forgotten knapsack behind the bar until he realized and came back. Alot of the staff were wonderful while we stayed the weekend but she is the one we will be telling our friends about back home. Thanks for making it a great time J Kennedy you are the Best. Janet and Lorenzo.
If you like overpaying for old hotel this is your. Old hotel not updated very expensive.

Not what I would expect for a Westin. Nice grounds but a bit outdated. I payed a little extra because I thought the Westin would be nicer than the Hyat or Hilton which are 3 star hotels. The valet staff and door staff were on point. The room smelt of a dirty washcloth when we first walked in and the shower was in need of a dusting and maintenance. It would have been an awesome hotel a few years ago. But it is in need of a update refresher.

Good hotel. Hotel is located in a great spot on one of the major streets running east and west Ocean Blvd. you are about a 10minute walk from the beach and situated in a 5 minute walking distance from a bunch of great restaurants. The hotel itself could use an update bathrooms carpets in the rooms etc. Parking under the hotel is also a bit tight for larger vehicles we drive a Toyota Highlander and found the spots tight and the ceiling low. Good price for the decent hotels in the area.

The lobby area of hotel needs renovation in addition to elevators hallways and floors. The room is nice and rain shower head refreshing. Location is great as it is near Promenade Pike Shoreline Village and Catalina Express port.

Not great. After a long two weeks in California for business I decided to treat myself to the Westin for my last night before heading home to Canada. When I first got to the room I noticed the cooler for drinks not a fridge was not working. I called down to the front desk and they sent someone up from maintenance. He was friendly and got it running. I went to the pool for an hour and when I came back the cooler was not working again. All I wanted to do was chill some wine and drinks. I called down again and the front desk lady proceeded to tell me the cooler was not a fridge and that it does not get very cold. but she said she would send someone up. I was not very happy as the lady had attitude. I left the room for an hour and when I returned it was still warm. I pulled the TV stand away from the wall to see if the cooler was plugged in it was filthy so I put tv stand back. Then I ordered food and the front desk would not let delivery guy from Big Catch Seafood up. He tried calling but there was an issue with phone communication maybe because I have a Canadian phone. He waited downstairs for 30 minutes before he finally was able to get ahold of me. The front desk did not call or anything. That would have been easy enough for them to do. By the time I got the food I had 90 worth of semi warm seafood. Got to enjoy that with warm wine. Then I went to shower and the tub had something that looked like rust by the drain. I touched it with my flip flop and it was some kind of dirt. It did not go away even with me showering which I had to do in flip flops. that is a first for me in a 4 star hotel. The pool and work out room was nice. Maintenance guys hotel cleaning staff the front desk guy who checked me in. all friendly. Overall I will never be back to this hotel.

The pool and work out room was nice. Maintenance guys hotel cleaning staff the front desk guy who checked me in. all friendly. Overall I will never be back to this hotel.

Nice room but upcoming renovations hindering service. I stayed at the Westin Long Beach Jan 14 22 2018. The room was nice even though I found the bed a bit too firm. The staff was kind. However the Westin is starting renovations as we speak and to facilitate the renos they are allowing their stock to deplete. I went to the restaurant only twice as both times I tried to order items to only discover they were out and we are restocking until after the renos are complete. No draft beer available and the only bottle beer was Bud and a local porter. Other menu items were hit or miss. The renovation is indeed needed but allowing stock levels to fall negatively affect the client experience. I ended up eating drinking at the Renaissance hotel a block away. FWIW my colleague actually only stayed two nights then moved to the Renaissance for the remainder of our trip.

Conference Hotel. I attended a conference at the Long Beach Convention Center and this hotel was convenient and professional for that purpose. They were undergoing renovations in the lobby and the restaurant provided a classy menu with a variety of healthy options. Room service was also faster and better than at similar hotels.
Beautiful place especially after remodeling. ronie is the nicest valet he can help you with local spots.

Great Hotel. Great hotel family friendly and a nice getaway for a business trip. Westin employee Kobe has great attention to detail professionalism and overall a superb attitude which made our family feel comfortable even during their renovation and construction. Our family gives him 5 stars. This gentleman deserves a promotion. Cynthia.

Nice and new. Pro it is close by the dock to have a nice walk one grocery store 10 walking distance outlet same distance. They just refurbished the hotel and look great. Cons. windows quality so so bit noisy. Very cold in the hotel and the music at breakfast is way too high not relaxing. Beds too soft pillow same.

Great hotel very friendly staff. Centrally located in downtown Long Beach. Accessible to great nearby restaurants coffee shops and aquarium. The facilities went through a refresh so the lobby looks great and completely new. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to the corner room at an executive suite. There was plenty of space and the room was great. We also had the option for the breakfast which we really enjoyed. We got the avacado toast and the Benedict which were fantastic. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Nice Clean and Newly Remodeled. We picked this place because it is close to our daughters apartment and we were out for a visit. The lobby is well appointed and was newly remodeled. The elevators worked well and our room was quite comfortable. My wife loved their pillows I was not so enamored with them. We did have one hitch. I needed some ice and the ice dispenser on the 6th floor was not working. The one on the 5th floor worked though. The bathroom has been refitted with a rain shower type shower which was a little fun to use. I had rather have the more traditional shower head personally but it worked. The room was on the 6th floor and was fairly quiet unles the Queen Mary was blowing her fog horn. it is hard to miss that when it goes ofNo problems on our visit and check out was a breeze. This is a good place to stay if you are in Long Beach.

This is a good place to stay if you are in Long Beach.

A great place and a professional team. Westin Long Beach is not only a great place to say conveniently located in down town in walking distance from all things fun and from the conference center and theater but also a wonderful place to relax w both family and colleagues. Great meeting spaces and a gorgeous interior just recently redone. The event staff is amazing to work with fast efficient and accommodating and always utmost professional. Whether for a stay of 1 or many this is a great place to be.
Freshly renovated clean inviting very nice vibe.
I alway go downtown to the westin its the most beautiful place around. They remodeled it and its even better anybody and everybody should get a chance to visit this place its wonderful.
